title: Left Coast 2015 Truffle Hill Estate Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: This wine is aromatic in tones of red and black berries, cedar and tobacco. The palate brings plum and black cherry flavors, with drying tannins that leave a lingering taste of black tea.

title: Mastroberardino 2017 Radici  (Fiano di Avellino)
description: White spring flower, acacia and tropical fruit aromas lift out of the glass. On the smooth, rounded palate, tangy acidity and a mineral vein energize ripe yellow apple, juicy pear and a drop of honey. A hint of toasted almond signals the close.

title: Mirafiore 2014 Blanc de Noirs Brut Pinot Nero (Alta Langa)
description: Aromas of bread crust, field flower and yellow stone fruit lift out of the glass. On the silky palate, bright acidity lifts peach, chopped herb, toasted almond and citrus zest alongside a refined perlage.

title: Neely 2016 Holly's Cuvee Spring Ridge Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: Toasted oak, sandalwood, pine, lemon peels and dried apple show on the nose of this bottling from the appellation's northernmost stretches. The palate starts with the freshness of cut lemon before dwelling back on the intense and savory qualities of aged wood and sea salt.

title: Omen 2017 Red (Sierra Foothills)
description: For those who like a hint of sweetness and a ton of dark jammy fruit flavors, this wine is a no-brainer. A blend of 50% Zinfandel plus Barbera, Syrah and Petite Sirah, it smells and tastes chocolaty, berry-like and superripe, and has a velvety texture that soothes the palate.

title: Open Claim 2015 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: This well-funded new effort has released its first wines, from a vineyard planted in 2012. The wines show plenty of potential, though young vines cannot fully express all the secrets of the land in which they grow. Light berry flavors and highlights of toast and breakfast tea are in focus. Consulting winemaker Tony Rynders has used one new and one neutral barrel for this limited offering, keeping flavors in balance. Off to a good start, this is a winery to watch.

title: Persona Non Grata 2015 Red (Lake County)
description: Very ripe and concentrated fruit flavors are framed by light oak spices in this full-bodied and round-textured wine. It has a generous mouthfeel, deep black-plum flavors and a good sense of richness, partly due no doubt to a hefty alcohol level.

title: Piazzo 2015  Barbaresco
description: Aromas of woodland berry, new leather and forest floor lead the nose. The savory palate offers red cherry, star anise and white pepper alongside polished tannins and fresh acidity. Drink 2020–2027.

title: Poças 2013 Late Bottled Vintage  (Port)
description: This is a sweet rich style of LBV, full of ripe plum fruits as well as raisins. The luscious texture of the wine is nicely lifted by acidity at the end. This style of Port, with its tannins still there, can be aged further. So either drink it now or wait until 2022.

title: Prunotto 2013 Bussia  (Barolo)
description: Woodland berry, tilled soil, dried rose, new leather and aromatic herb aromas come together in this fragrant, racy red. It's rather light in body and ethereal for Barolo, already accessible, offering flavors of tart sour cherry, clove and chopped dill. Firm acidity and polished tannins provide lithe support. Drink through 2025.

title: Quinta do Pessegueiro 2016 Vintage  (Port)
description: This fruity style is immediately attractive, ripe with dusty tannins and blackberry fruit. It is not a powerful wine although its tannins do promise longevity as well as a fine sense of structure. Drink the wine from 2028.

title: Riofavara NV Metodo Classico Extra Brut Sparkling (Sicilia)
description: Made with 90% Moscato and 10% Grecanico, this racy sparkler opens with aromas of citrus, crushed herb and a whiff of yellow stone fruit. Reflecting the nose, the vibrant palate delivers dried apricot, flinty minerality and lemon alongside an elegant, continuous perlage.

title: Riverbench 2016 Bedrock Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Quite rich on the nose, this bottling from a historic property deep in the appellation shows loads of honeysuckle and gardenia on the nose as well as lemon bar, nectarine, candied apple and a flash of nuts. It lands with ripe power on the palate, carrying hints of mango and pome fruits.

title: Schloss Saarstein 2017 Pinot Blanc (Mosel)
description: Crisp, cutting white grapefruit and pear flavors lend freshness to this full-bodied but invigorating white. It's silky and expansive on the palate but balanced by zesty acidity and a pleasant rim of astringency on the finish.

title: Schnaitmann 2013 Trocken Sauvignon Blanc (Württemberg)
description: Fresh yellow peach and apple flavors are accented with cashew, green plum and lime zest in this dry but intensely fruity Sauvignon Blanc. It's a full-bodied yet zesty wine marked by a fresh, lingering finish.

title: Sonsierra 2013 Pagos de la Sonsierra Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Dark smoky charred aromas lend a crusty, slightly burnt topping to the nose. In the mouth, this cool-vintage wine is wiry, with magnetic midpalate acidity. Saucy flavors of plum and berry finish savory and tight. Fitting for a 2013, this is never overly ripe. Drink through 2022.

title: Sonsierra 2014 Crianza Vendimia Seleccionada  (Rioja)
description: Ripe berry aromas suggest raisin and graphite. A flush palate is full in body and displaying good structure. Roasted berry and plum flavors are meaty in front of a savory finish that tastes of soy sauce and grilled beef. Drink through 2020.

title: Sparkman 2015 Rainmaker Cabernet Sauvignon (Yakima Valley)
description: A blend of fruit from Olsen and Kiona vineyards. Brooding dried herb, black cherry and spice aromas are followed by a supple, flavorful palate, bursting with cherry, cedar and plum notes that extend on the finish. This one is all about subtlety and sophistication, and it brings both in abundance.

title: St. Francis 2015 Reserve Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Brimming with a sweetness of baked cherry and molasses, this is a soft, rounded and robustly ripe wine that carries its weight well. A touch of structured, high-toned acidity complements the power and outer reaches of excess, allowing the experience on the palate to speak.

title: Stags' Leap Winery 2014 Twelve Falls Red (Stags Leap District)
description: This is an estate-grown combination of half Cabernet Sauvignon with 40% Petite Sirah and 10% Merlot. It offers moderation and grace within its juicy core of muted black fruit, cedar and gamy meat seasoned in black pepper.
